criteria: Clarity of Relationships Among Details and Ideas
descriptions: The response does not identify any central ideas or information from the source.
The response identifies a central idea or information, but it is vague or inaccurate.
The response identifies a central idea or information, but lacks depth or detail.
The response identifies a central idea or information with reasonable accuracy and detail.
The response clearly and accurately identifies the central ideas or information of the source.
The response insightfully and comprehensively identifies the central ideas or information of the source.
The response provides no summary or an entirely inaccurate summary of the source.
The summary provided contains major inaccuracies or omissions.
The summary provided contains some inaccuracies or omissions.
The summary provided is generally accurate, but may lack some key details.
The summary provided is accurate and includes the most important details.
The summary provided is exceptionally accurate, comprehensive, and well-articulated.
The response fails to make clear any relationships among the key details and ideas.
The response attempts to show relationships among details and ideas, but it is unclear or confusing.
The response identifies some relationships among details and ideas, but lacks depth.
The response shows a reasonable understanding of the relationships among the key details and ideas.
The response clearly shows the relationships among the key details and ideas.
The response insightfully and comprehensively explains the relationships among all the key details and ideas.
